text:
"Feels" is a song recorded and produced by Scottish DJ Calvin Harris. It features vocals from American singer-songwriters Pharrell Williams, Katy Perry and American rapper Big Sean. It was released on 16 June 2017 through Sony Music as the fourth single from his fifth studio album Funk Wav Bounces Vol. 1 (2017), after "Slide", "Heatstroke" and "Rollin". Starrah assisted the artists in writing the song.[2][3]

"Feels" has reached number one in Israel, Latvia, and the United Kingdom, the top 10 in Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, the Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, Ireland, Lebanon, Malaysia, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Portugal, Scotland, Slovakia, and Switzerland, the top 20 in Finland, Poland, and Sweden, and the top 30 in Spain and the United States.

Release

On 14 June 2017, Calvin Harris announced on social media that he would be releasing the fourth single from Funk Wav Bounces Vol. 1 on 15 June 2017, which named "Feels". The post included the single cover art and credits of "Feels".[4]

Critical reception

Andy Cush of Spin called the song a little flimsy, but an unimpeachable groove. "It has a skillful melange of sounds from the mid-70s apex of analog recording, the era of disco and yacht rock: a warm and rounded bassline, some Nile Rodgers-style guitar, a slick descending line on Fender Rhodes."[5] Rolling Stone's Elia Leight said that the song is "a simple, lighthearted loop, which combines punctual ska guitar, a playful keyboard line and charming squeaks that recall a cartoon character's slip on a banana peel."[6] Brent Faulkner from The Musical Hype said the song is undercooked, leaving more to be desired, adding that it's "the type of record that is pleasing more because of the sound than the lyricism."[7]

Music video

The song's accompanying music video was uploaded to Harris' Vevo channel on YouTube on 26 June 2017. The music video was directed by Emil Nava.[8] In the video, Harris, Williams, Perry and Big Sean lounge around on a desert island.[9]
